hedline.hl1: Woman Held in Brooklyn Bank Robbery

abstract.p: Valerie Coletti is arrested after robbing Banco Popular in Sheepshead Bay section of Brooklyn; teller gave description of woman to police and told them she had boarded a bus; police found Coletti on bus with $8,300 and two pellet guns; she is charged with armed robbery and weapons possession (S)

block.p: A 41-year-old Brooklyn woman was arrested yesterday morning after she robbed a Sheepshead Bay bank with a pellet gun and made her getaway on a crowded city bus, the police said.

The woman, Valerie Coletti of 2256 Ralph Avenue, was arrested a few blocks from the Banco Popular at 1619 Sheepshead Bay Road, the police said. They said a teller flagged a police van and told the officers that a blond woman wearing brown gloves and sunglasses had just robbed the bank and boarded the B-49 bus.
A 41-year-old Brooklyn woman was arrested yesterday morning after she robbed a Sheepshead Bay bank with a pellet gun and made her getaway on a crowded city bus, the police said.

The woman, Valerie Coletti of 2256 Ralph Avenue, was arrested a few blocks from the Banco Popular at 1619 Sheepshead Bay Road, the police said. They said a teller flagged a police van and told the officers that a blond woman wearing brown gloves and sunglasses had just robbed the bank and boarded the B-49 bus.

When the officers boarded the bus a few blocks away at a traffic light at Ocean Avenue and Avenue Z, they found Ms. Coletti sitting in the back, clutching a blue plastic bag filled with $8,300 in unmarked bills, a pair of sneakers, a plastic beverage cooler and two pellet guns, they said. She has been charged with armed robbery and weapons possession, the police said.

The officers said that Ms. Coletti, whom they described as a frail woman about five feet tall, told them that she used a disability pass to board the bus because she did not have enough money for a cab.
The officers said that as they escorted her off the bus, Ms. Coletti told them, ''Going to jail is better than home.''
